definition: Happening once every year; a plant that lives for one year; a yearly publication.
examples: Sports day is an annual event at our school.
We planted colourful annuals along the path.

extra.memory_tip: Annual = happens each year, like your birthday.

definition: Made by people rather than occurring naturally; not genuine.
examples: The flowers looked real but were artificial.
Artificial light helps plants grow indoors.

definition: To mix together smoothly; a mixture of different things.
examples: Blend the fruit and yoghurt for a smoothie. (verb)
This tea is a blend of herbs. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Blend = ‘bend’ flavours together until they match.

definition: To make someone feel uninterested; to make a hole by drilling; a dull person or thing; the space inside a tube.
examples: Long speeches can bore the audience. (verb)
The engineer bored a hole through the panel. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Bore = boooor-ing, or boring a hole.

definition: Fairly large in size, amount, or importance.
examples: The project required considerable effort.
She saved a considerable sum of money.

definition: In a natural or rough state; simple and not carefully made; rude; unrefined petroleum.
examples: They built a crude shelter from branches. (adjective)
The country exports crude oil. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Crude = not yet smoothed or refined.

definition: To change from liquid to gas; to disappear gradually.
examples: Pools of water evaporate in the sun.
Their excitement evaporated after the delay.

definition: The leaves of a plant or many plants together.
examples: Autumn foliage turns red and gold.
The path was shaded by thick foliage.

extra.memory_tip: Foliage = a ‘folio’ of leaves on display.

definition: A long deep cut; to make a long deep cut.
examples: He had a gash on his knee. (noun)
She gashed her hand on the tin lid. (verb)
The sky changed hue at sunset.
Mixing blue and yellow makes a greenish hue.

definition: To become larger in number, amount, or size; a growth or rise.
examples: We increased the temperature by two degrees. (verb)
There was a small increase in rainfall. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Increase = step ‘in’ to a higher number.

definition: To feed and help grow; to support and strengthen.
examples: Good food nourishes the body.
Reading nourishes the mind.

definition: To change or be different; to make changes to something.
examples: Temperatures vary across the country.
We varied the recipe to make it less sweet.

definition: The ability to see; a vivid mental picture or plan for the future.
examples: Protect your vision with safety glasses.
The team shared a clear vision for the project.

extra.memory_tip: Vision = eyes for now and ideas for later.

definition: To produce or provide; to give way; the amount produced.
examples: The farm yields plenty of fruit. (verb)
Please yield to traffic from the right. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Yield = yield fruit or yield the right of way.
